articles.title: AI can convert almost any 3D scene into the style of a famous artwork
articles.description: Artificial intelligence can transfer artistic styles onto a 3D scene, including turning a bulldozer into the style of Van Gogh’s The Starry Night painting
articles.content:
By Jeremy Hsu
3D images of a bulldozer turned into the style of an image known as Glowing Tiger, Sunday at Port en Bessin by Georges-Pierre Seurat and The Starry Nightby Vincent van Gogh
Kai Zhang,… [+471 chars]

articles.title: We really can become ‘hangry’, suggests first real-world test of idea
articles.description: Some lab-based work has suggested we can become more irritable when we are hungry – now the phenomenon has been seen in the real-world too
articles.content:
By Clare Wilson
New research suggests that we truly can become ‘hangry’
Nicoleta Ionescu/Shutterstock
Most people know the feeling of being so hungry that it starts to make them angry there is eve… [+2267 chars]

articles.title: A passing star shifting Neptune’s orbit could wreck the solar system
articles.description: If a star flying past our solar system moved Neptune's orbit by just 0.1 per cent, it could eventually cause the other planets to smash into one another or get thrown out of the solar system entirely
articles.content:
By Leah Crane
If a passing star pushed Neptune a tiny bit further from the sun, it could eventually throw the solar system into chaos
Shutterstock/24K-Production
If a neighbouring star gets too cl… [+390 chars]

articles.title: Bats in Germany are riddled with pesticides and toxic pollutants
articles.description: Tests on 387 bats from five species found that all were exposed to high levels of polychlorinated biphenyls and organochlorine insecticides, legacy pollutants that have long been banned
articles.content:
By Sean Mowbray
A greater mouse-eared bat (Myotis myotis)
Top-Pics TBK/Alamy
Bats across Germany are riddled with residues of pesticides and persistent organic pollutants, according to the largest… [+498 chars]

articles.title: Meta's AI can translate between 204 languages, including rare ones
articles.description: Facebook's owner Meta has created an AI model that can translate dozens more languages than the biggest current tools, and the company also claims the results are better than those of competitors
articles.content:
By Matthew Sparkes
AI models can translate your typed words into hundreds of other languages
Carol Yepes/Getty Images

articles.title: Time loops may not be forbidden by physics after all
articles.description: Physicists find that causal loops, where two events separated in time influence each other in paradoxical ways, are allowed in many theoretical universes, some of which share features with our own
articles.content:
By Karmela Padavic-Callaghan
In certain universes, achieving a time loop is possible without breaking physics
andrey_l/Shutterstock
A causal loop is a classic time travel conundrum. If you send in… [+369 chars]

articles.title: Drugs used to treat ADHD and depression may ease Alzheimer's symptoms
articles.description: A class of drugs commonly used to treat ADHD and other conditions could improve cognition and decrease apathy in people with Alzheimer's
articles.content:

An MRI scan of a person with Alzheimer’s disease
Atthapon Raksthaput/Shutterstock

articles.title: US chooses encryption tools to protect us from quantum computers
articles.description: The National Institute of Standards and Technology has revealed the next generation of algorithms that will keep our private data safe from snoopers
articles.content:

articles.title: Snapping shrimps have helmets to ward off shock waves from their claws
articles.description: Snapping shrimps seem immune to the shock waves their claws produce to kill or stun other animals – and it is all thanks to their head gear
articles.content:

articles.title: Fields medal 2022: Work on prime numbers and spheres wins maths prize
articles.description: Mathematicians who have studied the most efficient way to pack spheres in eight-dimensional space and the spacing of prime numbers are among this year's recipients of the highest award in mathematics, the Fields medal
articles.content:

The four Fields medal winners, clockwise from top left: Maryna Viazovska, James Maynard, June Huh and Hugo Duminil-Copin
